bug.author: yaroslavvb
bug.description:
There doesn't seem to be a correspondence between global_step and step in my graphs. I'm using wandb through eventwriter API in PyTorch. Debugging a bit, it seems step gets converted to global_step here
client/wandb/tensorboard/__init__.py
Line 205 in 6417dd9
values[namespaced_tag("global_step", namespace)
Then wandb.log gets called with this dict, it doesn't see step so it assigns one automatically Custom global step is useful to compare data efficiency consistency across runs -- using "forward calls" as x-axis means your curves look 2x better when doubling batch size or number of workers. Using global data counter for steps gives easier to interpret curves <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vanpelt>@vanpelt</denchmark-link>

For consistency with TensorBoard I think it should keep step value as step instead of renaming to global_step in tf_summary_to_dict, currently those graphs are off by 100x for my runs <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23068/66968433-08ec8b00-f03a-11e9-9e27-62089fa4fd14.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23068/66968439-0d18a880-f03a-11e9-95e7-2b2bdbc6c8c8.png></denchmark-link>

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yaroslavvb>@yaroslavvb</denchmark-link> we did this intentionally. To make the graphs lineup you can set the x-axis in the wandb interface to be global_step instead of our step. There's a global "x-axis" button in the vix panel, and you can set them individually in a custom vis chart. The reason we did this is that a single tensorboard folder might have multiple tfevent files with different steps such as train, val, or in some cases far more complex setups. We also wanted users to be able to sync tensorboard and call wandb.log for custom objects which detaching the steps helps with. I know this isn't ideal. The first thing we should do is in runs where we have a global_step logged we should use that as the default axis. We're also in the process of refactoring the backend to better support these complex scenarios.

Ah, I see, didn't realize there are now custom X-axis fields. I see "learning rate" and "Train accuracy" in there as well. I think it's reasonable to assume that most TensorBoard user set their step values manually -- the front-end only allows one kind of step and if you don't set it the training accuracy graphs get collapsed into one point

Yeah, we look for any metrics that are monotonically increasing and make them available as x-axis options. MLFlow, Tensorboard, and others allow you to go back in time during training and we don't. By putting the step in metrics we're punting the missing feature by allowing users to log historic steps at the cost of using them as an x-axis (but still being able to export via the python ap). The big rewrite will enable this behaviour. We're seeing a bunch of users syncing tensorboard, so we should atleast default to global_step as the x-axis in this case.
Thanks for the info, closing it as duplicate of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/issues/613>#613</denchmark-link>
